bug.author: zthassassin
bug.description: Hi, Avinash Paliwal I try to use 'Jupyter notebook' to open train.ipynb, but Jupyter notebook says "Unreadable Notebook: F:\Super-SloMo-master\train.ipynb NotJSONError('Notebook does not appear to be JSON: '{\n "nbformat": 4,\n "nbformat_minor"...',)" Is this a bug or there is other method to run train.ipynb ?

comments.comment: Hi, Thanks for pointing out the bug. I have fixed the notebook, try running it again.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avinashpaliwal>@avinashpaliwal</denchmark-link> hello avinash how do i run the train.ipynb in conda environment...i know for python we use python filename.py and then enter ,,,so it runs

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/eng100200>@eng100200</denchmark-link> if you have downloaded the <denchmark-link:https://docs.anaconda.com/anaconda/navigator/>anaconda UI application</denchmark-link> , you can launch the <denchmark-link:https://medium.com/@brianray_7981/jupyterlab-first-impressions-e6d70d8a175d>JupyterLab</denchmark-link> or <denchmark-link:https://jupyter-notebook-beginner-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/execute.html>Notebook</denchmark-link>
or run the command from project directory: jupyter notebook or jupyter lab Then you can open the train.ipynb file in jupyter. I am also going to commit train.py, so that you can train it directly from terminal.
Thanks Avinash Paliwal, and happy new year. However, I mean Avinash Paliwal that i still want to use python command prompt and want to run ipynb file. then how can i do it?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/eng100200>@eng100200</denchmark-link> I have added the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/avinashpaliwal/Super-SloMo/blob/master/train.py>train.py</denchmark-link> script. You can now train from terminal.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/avinashpaliwal>@avinashpaliwal</denchmark-link> your train net use UNET,right, so it can be used for mobile devices?
